speakers.name: maria leonova
speakers.text: Maria specialises in adding the missing pieces to many Agile transformations: training the product teams and consulting on strategy, structure, and process. A frequent speaker, Maria has had the pleasure of addressing audiences in over 20 different countries. Maria is currently writing about her experiences for O'Reilly in the book.

speakers.name: nick brown
speakers.text: Nick is a NYC-based software engineer at Spotify working on developing data privacy infrastructure. In the past, he's worked worked at Facebook, Snapchat and Google, and has lived in Germany and South Africa.

speakers.name: peter vanderbilt
speakers.text: Peter is passionate about program management and bringing cross functional teams together to really deliver on company strategy. He introduced the discipline to Intercom, seizing the opportunity to enable the company to deliver product at scale, without slowing down.

speakers.name: anna smith
speakers.text: With over 20 years of experience in complex product development in both software & hardware, Anna has previously led Agile transition efforts in top telecommunications firms and worked with North Carolina State University to conduct research on Agile Test-Driven development.

speakers.name: ben portman
speakers.position: SENIOR SERVICE AND UX DESIGNER, IXDS
speakers.text: Ben currently works as Senior Service and UX Designer at the leading German innovation agency IXDS covering every step of the service design process from research, strategy to the nitty-gritty details of interaction and visual design.

speakers.name: keith alexander
speakers.text: Keith is a designer with a background in Service & Interaction Desiis a designer with a background in Service & Interaction Design. During his career, Keith has served in a broad range of roles, designing digital products and services in several sectors, including healthcare, web development, and the automotive and travel & leisure industries.

speakers.name: haruki yamada
speakers.text: Haruki is not an Innovation Coach, a Product Ideation Guru or a Creativity Mentor. He will not shatter your paradigms, make you forget everything you thought you knew, or unveil a new, futuristic model. What he is, however, is a creative Multidisciplinary Designer who works at Lisbon-based Strategic Design Consultancy.

speakers.name: marcos caceres
speakers.text: Marcos has spent the last four years working with Mozilla's DOM team hacking on Firefox, writing PWA-related W3C specifications, and co-chairing the W3C's Web Incubator Community Group - all proudly from Melbourne, Australia! Previously, Marcos worked at Opera Software in Oslo, Norway.

speakers.name: jack zeman
speakers.text: Jack is a freelance front-end UI/UX developer, trainer and speaker from Lebanon. He partners with design teams to execute and build beautiful, progressive Web user interfaces and design systems, with a strong focus on responsive design, performance, and accessibility, using the latest front-end design techniques.

speakers.name: paul heasley
speakers.text: Paul is passionate about creating beautiful UI's that connect emotionally with users. He's excited by the opportunities that new technology opens up and is inspired by the innovators, free-thinkers and open source contributors in our community.

speakers.name: Isabel Brison
speakers.text: Isabel is a front end engineer at Fairfax Media, where she has worked on all the metro mastheads, across two completely different tech stacks and is currently building the second iteration of their design system. When she is not coding she can usually be found tending the veggie patch or spending quality time with her cats.

speakers.name: xavier ho
speakers.text: Xavier's focuses on high-impact, real-time data visualisation, data-driven engineering, and design at CSIRO Data61. His recent work on CSIRO's TraNSIT was recommended by the Office of Northern Australia. In his spare time, he fiddles with generative art, and code.

speakers.name: marcin szczenski
speakers.text: A developer for almost twenty years, Marcin has worked with the web as it evolved from static pages to the rich JavaScript applications we see today. Starting in the corporate world, and later a digital agency, Marcin is currently a Principal Frontend Developer at Atlassian.

speakers.name: mandy michael
speakers.text: Mandy is a community organiser, speaker, and developer working as the Front End Development Manager at Seven West in Western Australia. She is a co-organiser and Director of Mixin Conf, and the founder and co-organiser of Fenders.

speakers.name: michael pena
speakers.text: Michael is an experienced Technical Consultant currently working with Readify in Sydney, Australia, a Microsoft MVP and a certified professional with more than 5 years of working experience ranging from Mobile, Cloud, Web, DevOps and Blockchain.

speakers.name: jason o'neil
speakers.text: Jason lives in Perth and works remotely as a front-end software engineer for Culture Amp. He loves thinking about ways we can improve developer experience, and make it easier and faster for us to make high quality, accessible websites and apps.

speakers.name: craig sharkie
speakers.text: Founder and lead wrangler at Sydney's JavaScript meet-up, SydJS, founder at SydJS, JavaScript communities for new Developers and inexperienced Developers

speakers.name: helga willson
speakers.text: Helga is a self-taught designer and developer with an inordinate love for CSS. Reducing lines of code in her web projects makes her extremely happy. She used to play basketball full-time and launched her web career during downtime between training sessions.

talks.title: Shipping Product at Scale
talks.speaker: peter vanderbilt
talks.text: Done well program management enables teams to do their jobs well, better, by acting as the glue that ties everyone together.

talks.title: How Designers and Engineers Can Better Work Together
talks.speaker: nick brown
talks.text: Learn about things designers can do to make collaborating with engineers smoother.

talks.title: Blending physical and digital design
talks.speaker: keith alexander
talks.text: The emphasis is shifting onto how best to use it as an invisible enabler of physical and sensory experiences, and how to create the conditions to enable and deliver new experiences to the end users.

talks.title: Product Discovery Micro Sprint
talks.speaker: anna smith
talks.text: Learn how to identify and model the customer jobs as possible opportunities for innovation.

talks.title: Creating products and services people will buy
talks.speaker: ben portman
talks.text: In the workshop, you will learn hands-on how to find out what customers want and how they form their jobs to be done.

talks.title: Using CSS (and SVG) for the Good of UX
talks.speaker: jack zeman
talks.text: Building the interface that users interact with impacts on how the user feels when they do, whether they *can* use it properly.

talks.title: The Double-W Process: to Sprint a Sprinted Model
talks.speaker: haruki yamada
talks.text: Take part in a super sprinted version of the Double-W process, a remote lean branding service developed by With Company.

talks.title: The State of Authentication
talks.speaker: marcos caceres
talks.text: Let's look at the current state of authentication on the Web, and in particular Web Authentication, an effort to standardise web based authentication.

talks.title: Defining and Measuring Value
talks.speaker: maria leonova
talks.text: Let's talk about setting the right goals, from a business and customer standpoint, and how we choose the right metrics to measure.

talks.title: Return of the script tag
talks.speaker: paul heasley
talks.text: With ES6 native modules support landing in major browsers, and tools like unpkg.com there's a growing interest in front-end development without the build systems and local compilation.

talks.title: Programming Generative Art
talks.speaker: xavier ho
talks.text: This talk aims to lower that barrier for you to take home and practice creative coding.

talks.title: UI architecture in the age of design systems
talks.speaker: Isabel Brison
talks.text: Should the app architecture be influenced by Atomic principles? How do we represent state changes in the design system?

talks.title: Scaling frontend development
talks.speaker: marcin szczenski
talks.text: Find out what is Tangerine - a program to standardise principles that define a world class frontend application as it scales up.

talks.title: Functional HTML
talks.speaker: mandy michael
talks.text: Let's talk HTML, semantics and why choosing the right html elements will help you write better, cleaner more efficient code

talks.title: Blockchain for Web Developers
talks.speaker: michael pena
talks.text: The speaker coming from a developer background himself, will bridge the gap the knowledge to fast-track the audience in DApps development.

talks.title: Your web page never listens to me
talks.speaker: jason o'neil
talks.text: How can we use the well supported Speech Synthesis API, and the still new SR API, to teach our pages to talk, and to listen?

talks.title: Functional CSS yesterday
talks.speaker: craig sharkie
talks.text: Your CSS can already be just* as functional as JavaScript. It is pure, can be immutable, and can be reasoned about.

talks.title: A new frontier for web design
talks.speaker: helga willson
talks.text: Modern CSS gives us a comprehensive set of tools that lets us embrace the fluidity of the web.
